candidates.title: Remove acme command
candidates.body:
* We remove acme command in favor of already existing bot implementation. We want to provide a better integration than this one with a fully automated implementation like caddy or nginx provide. You could take a look of advancement on this issue #926 
* We remove this command to remove the last dependency to openssl in favor of rustls

candidates.title: chore(e2e): use rustls instead of openssl
Bump dependencies
candidates.body:

* Bump command dependencies
* Bump e2e dependencies
* Bump binary dependencies

candidates.title: protobuf types
candidates.body:
In order to have other APIs send requests to Sōzu, we will define `Request`, `Response` and `State` in protobuf.

This PR translates the contained types in protobuf, step by step.

candidates.title: Refactor http state

milestone.title: HTTP2
milestone.description:
For various reasons we need Sōzu to implement the [HTTP2 protocol](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc9113). This requires a great deal of tasks and refactoring everywhere.

We want Sōzu to be able to:

- passthrough HTTP1.1
- passthrough HTTP2
- translate from one to the other and vice-versa

An important piece of the solution lies in developping a library called [Kawa](https://github.com/CleverCloud/kawa), a generic HTTP representation, and integrate it into Sōzu. As of august 2023, Kawa handles HTTP1.1 in Sōzu.

candidates.body:
In order to support HTTP2 in Sōzu, there is a number of steps to take. This is one of them.

This PR aims to normalize the `State`s of the various protocols (`Expect`, `Pipe`...), and to make them handle backend connection.

A side effect of this refactoring is to merge duplicate code of the `http` and `https` proxies into the `Http` state.

candidates.title: End to end tests proof of concept
candidates.body:
We want to test Sōzu's lib to be sure that all corner cases are checked.
This is intended for local development and inclusion in the CI.
